metadata.Title: CVE-2014-7936 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Use-after-free vulnerability in the ZoomBubbleView::Close function in browser/ui/views/location_bar/zoom_bubble_view.cc in the Views implementation in Google Chrome before 40.0.2214.91 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service or possibly have unspecified other impact via a crafted document that triggers improper maintenance of a zoom bubble.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-7936` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 40.0.2214.94-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1068
chromium-browser-l10n - 40.0.2214.94-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1068
chromium-chromedriver - 40.0.2214.94-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1068
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 40.0.2214.94-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1068
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 40.0.2214.94-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1068
No subscription required

notes.Note: chrisccoulson> The bug is in the Chrome / Chromium browser (above content)

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '40.0.2214.94-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1068').
